articles.description: Communicating the message is important.  It is not always sufficient, but if you are unable to communicate frankly, you are not going to make the right decisions for your business. Chris Sutton has defended Celtic after journalist Ian Ladyman questioned why Brendan Rodgers returned to the Hoops.
In an article he wrote last week for the Daily Mail, Ladyman expressed his opinion that Rodgers is squandering his best years as a manager at Celtic. However, Sutton disagreed with Ladyman's remarks.

Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers highlighted Luis Palma and Hyunjun Yang for praise after their performances in Celtic's 6-0 destruction of Aberdeen. 
Yang and Palma, who both joined Celtic in the summer, were both able to get on the scoresheet yesterday in a sensational performance from the Hoops, with Palma also registering a hat-trick of assists.
The post "You see the development"; Brendan Rodgers comments on emerging Celtic duo bode very well appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.

articles.author: Michael Shearer
articles.description:
Former Celtic goalkeeper Packie Bonner hailed Celtic's character after an incredible 6-0 win against Aberdeen saw the Bhoys go eight points clear at the top of the Scottish Premiership.
Celtic dominated Aberdeen from start to finish in their biggest win of the season despite the announcement of Daizen Maeda's injury on Friday. 
Hyunjun Yang opened the scoring for Celtic just nine minutes into the game, with Kyogo Furuhashi adding another after 16 minutes. Although they had to wait just over 60 minutes for their third goal, the Bhoys were clearly the dominant side and could have won the game by an even greater margin.
The post BBC Sportsound pundit raves about Celtic after routing Aberdeen with two standouts highlighted appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: BBC Sportsound pundit raves about Celtic after routing Aberdeen with two standouts highlighted

Former Celtic striker Chris Sutton hailed two Celtic stars as tremendous after yesterday's 6-0 win over Aberdeen.
After a tough midweek match against Atletico Madrid, Celtic bounced back against Aberdeen with a convincing victory, despite doubts about the team due to injuries to Daizen Maeda, Reo Hatate, and Liel Abada.
